Name: Pattern Recognition - PE
Text: Okay lets see The user wants me to create a list of targeted open ended questions to ask the interviewee about their property onboarding process The process is detailed and covers several stages initial contact documentation review property manager assignment photographer and inspector visits issue resolution marketing activation tenant screening quality checks and exceptions

Name: Deductive Reasoning - PE
Text: First I need to make sure each question targets a different aspect The user mentioned uncovering missing details understanding decision criteria clarifying roles and responsibilities verifying timing and sequencing and learning about exceptions Let me think about each of these points

Name: Hypothesis Generation - PE
Text: For missing details maybe ask about specific steps or documents that werent mentioned For example what if a property has outdated records and they need to update them That would show the interviewees attention to detail

Name: Hypothesis Generation - PE
Text: Deciding criteria They mentioned factors like workload geographic specializations experience and unique requirements Maybe ask about why they choose a particular property manager or how they assess the risk of a property

Name: Hypothesis Generation - PE
Text: Roles and responsibilities They mentioned assigning a manager and handling tenant screening So maybe ask about how the manager handles communication and ensures all parties are informed

Name: Hypothesis Generation - PE
Text: Timing and sequencing The process is sequential so questions about when each step occurs and how they interact For example when does the photographer visit and how does that affect marketing

Name: Hypothesis Generation - PE
Text: Exceptions The interviewee mentioned handling special cases like insurance or custom clauses Maybe ask about the exceptions and how theyre managed

Name: Validation - PE
Text: Also check if the questions are open ended and dont involve SQL or implementation details Need to ensure each question is focused on a conceptual aspect without being too technical

Name: Heuristic Reasoning - PE
Text: Let me structure this into a list making sure each question is distinct and covers all the points Avoid repetition and ensure clarity
